summary:
Urges States to issue guidance to ships flying their flag on precautionary measures to protect against attacks off the coast of Somalia.

Calls upon States and regional organizations to coordinate actions to address the situation.

Affirms that the provisions of this resolution apply only to Somalia and do not affect member States' rights or obligations under international law.

Looks forward to the Secretary-General's report on piracy and armed robbery off the coast of Somalia and intends to review the situation.

Decides to remain seized of the matter.
